content:
What is Padavan ?

Padavan firmware is a custom firmware for wireless routers. It is based on the open-source firmware of Asuswrt, which is the firmware developed by Asus for their routers. Padavan firmware is compatible with a wide range of routers and provides many advanced features, such as support for various VPN protocols, advanced QoS controls, and support for custom scripts and plugins.

It also aims to improve the performance and security of the routers. It is a third-party firmware and is not officially supported by the router’s manufacturer.

  • The firmware is developed by a Chinese developer and is offered as a free and open-source software.

Custom Firmwares for Mi 3C Router:

The Xiaomi Mi 3C router is a popular router that is known for its low cost and high performance. There are several custom firmware options available for the Mi 3C router. Some popular options include:

Padavan firmware

As I mentioned earlier, Padavan firmware is a custom firmware that is based on the open-source firmware of Asuswrt. It offers many advanced features and is compatible with a wide range of routers, including the Mi 3C.

OpenWRT firmware

OpenWRT is an open-source firmware that is designed for embedded devices such as routers. It offers a wide range of features and is highly customizable. There are several versions of OpenWRT firmware available for the Mi 3C router.

DD-WRT firmware

DD-WRT is another open-source firmware that is designed for wireless routers. It offers a wide range of features and is highly customizable. There are several versions of DD-WRT firmware available for the Mi 3C router.

X-WRT firmware

This is an open-source firmware that is based on OpenWRT, it provides more features and options than the original firmware, but it’s not as popular as the others.

Why Padavan and not others ?

There is nothing stopping you from installing other custom firmwares; however, from my testing, OpenWRT has a couple of bugs, and some features that you’d expect to work right out of the box don’t. Thus far, Padavan is the only firmware that has all the features that you’d expect, and they work seamlessly.

Installation Guide:

Here’s the reference guide on Github.

The guide will take you through, step by step on how to get any custom firmware up and running on your router initially. Later on in, the guide will be more specific to the Padavan Firmware.

It is worth mentioning that this guide can also be used for other routers as well. However, only as a reference.

DISCLAIMER: By installing a custom firmware, you will VOID any warranty associated with the device. As this is not an official guide and things can go wrong, I advise you to be wary of the steps, and I’m not responsible for any damages or Bricks.

Prerequisites

Have a wired connection to the router from your PC. Assign the Ethernet port a static IP such as 192.168.31.2.

Please Remember that you may need to change the static IP frequently as you proceed with the installation.

You may also need internet access for reference. (If you have a Wi-Fi card, it may be helpful)

Some basic Networking knowledge. Although the guide will give you all the information you need, it helps to know what you are doing.

A Linux machine. Don’t worry I’ll show you a method that doesn’t require VMs.

Setting Up linux

You don’t need a VM to run Linux. You can install it using WSL. If you haven’t heard about it, WSL stands for Windows Subsystem for Linux. It is a feature in Windows 10 or higher that allows users to run Linux command-line tools and utilities natively on Windows. This means that users can use Linux commands and utilities, such as Bash, directly in the Windows Command Prompt or PowerShell, without the need for a virtual machine or dual-booting.

Do note that you need Windows 10 2004 or higher for this to work

You can check the official documentation for a better understanding.

You also need to enable virtualization in your BIOS.

Once you have enabled virtualization, open a terminal or command prompt window with Administrator Privileges and type the following command:

wsl --install

Reboot your PC as the prompt says and after reboot it’ll continue installation. Proceed with the usual installation stuff, setting up username and password and so on.

Once Ubuntu is up and running we can proceed further.

Gaining Telnet Access

For this step, I recommend following this video

You may need to install Telnet tools on your Linux instance, just bear that in mind.

Installing Breed Bootloader

Once you have Telnet access, you need to transfer the bootloader file into the /tmp directory of the router.

You can do this via Filezilla or any application of your choice.

  • Username: root
  • Password: root
  • Port: 21

Once the file is transferred, open a terminal or cmd. Login via telnet using:

telent 192.168.31.1

Leave the password blank and hit enter.

Once you have logged in, type in the following command to install BREED:

mtd -e Bootloader -r write /tmp/breed-mt7688-reset38.bin Bootloader

Wait for the installation to take place. Do not unplug your router. Wait for a couple of minutes to make sure the nstallation completes.

You can enter via breed by heading over to

192.168.1.1

Do note that if you have assigned your PC a static IP, then you need to change it accordingly. Set your Pc’s IP address to

192.168.1.100

Installing a Firmware from Breed

It is recommended that you reset Breed to its default settings before you install any firmware:

Yes, it is in chinese. Surprise - Surprise ! You can use Google Translate to translate it into English, but I recommend doing it via a smartphone and Google Lens for convenience.

Use the image below for reference (Credit: @yuos-bit from Github):

To install a fimrware, head over to the second menu (on the left-hand lis of menus) and click on the option in the middle (in between Bootloader and EEPROM but Do NOT select Bootloader and EEPROM).

Upload your firmware file and install. You should be good to go.

Installing Padavan Firmware

From here on out the guide becomes specfic to Padvan Fimrware.

You can compile your own Padavan Firmware if you like, but I won’t be diving into that as we already have a pre-compiled firmware to work with. Firmware: MI-3C_3.4.3.9-099.trx.tar.gz (I did not create these files. The credit goes to the respective owners/creators.)

You do need to extract the firmware. You can extract it using your linux instance. I’ll be using Ubuntu that we installed earlier using wsl.

Paste the file into a working directory of Ubuntu. If you are using Windows 11, Linux should appear in the file explorer, and you can navigate to the directory.

If you are using Windows 10, then enter

\\wsl$\

In the file explorer address bar.

You can the extract the file by using the following command.

tar -xf MI-3C_3.4.3.9-099.trx.tar.gz

After extracting, upload the .tar firmware file to Breed as stated before and proceed with the installation.

If you can access the login page at -

192.168.2.1

(assuming that you have either set a static IP in the subnet or set to automatic IP) then you have successfully installed padavan.

The default username and password is admin and admin respectively. You should be able to log in into your router.

Changing language in Padavan Firmware.

By default, everything is in chinese.

You can change the language by heading over to the administration menu (5th menu from the wrench icon), System (First menu) and then scrolling all the way down to the last menu and selecting English from the drop-down.

Conclusion

If you have made it so far then congratulations. You now have a powerful custom firmware to meet all your networking needs on a simple home router !
description: A complete guide on installing Padavan firmaware (or any custom firmware) on your Mi 3C Router.
title: Padavan Firmware for Mi 3C Router

content:
Zerotier: The Ultimate Solution for Bypassing CG-NAT

Are you tired of dealing with the hassle of Carrier-Grade Network Address Translation (CG-NAT)? Look no further than Zerotier!

What is Zerotier?

Zerotier is a software-based network overlay that allows you to connect devices, services, and apps seamlessly, regardless of their physical location. With Zerotier, you can bypass the limitations of CG-NAT and enjoy unrestricted access to the internet.

The Benefits of Zerotier

Virtual networks that span across different locations: With Zerotier, you can create virtual networks that can span across different locations. This means that you can connect devices and services from different parts of the world as if they were in the same local network. This is especially useful for businesses with remote employees or for anyone who wants to access their home network from anywhere in the world.

Easy to use: Zerotier is a simple, plug-and-play solution that requires no additional hardware or complicated configuration. All you need to do is install the Zerotier client on your devices, and you’re good to go.

Why Zerotier and not something else ?

  • First off, it’s FREE.

During my reasearch, I came acccross many ‘options’ / ‘services’ to bypass CG-NAT. One of them was Cloudflare’s Zero Tunnel. Although very convenient if set up right, it posed a big problem and that was that it was impossible to stream content from services like plex outside your network.

However, Zerotier seamed to fix that issue. Streaming works great. It’s also a better option if you want to VPN into your network instead of having a tunnel open at all times. Not to mention it also doesnt require a credit card to register even though both services are free.

Zerotier Setup

General Guidelines to set up Zerotier

  1. Sign up for a free account on the Zerotier website at their website

 

  1. Once you have created an account and logged in, click on the “Networks” tab, then click on the “Create a Network” button.

 

  1. Give your network a name, and then click on the “Create” button.

 

  1. Once your network is created, click on the “Members” tab, and then click on the “Add Members” button. Here, you can add the devices that you want to be part of the network. You can add members by their Zerotier ID or by their device’s IP address.

 

  1. Download and install the Zerotier client on all the devices that you want to add to the network.

 

  1. Once the client is installed, open it and enter your Zerotier account’s authtoken.
  2. Join the network by clicking on the "+" button on the network you want to join, or by entering the network’s ID.

 

  1. Once the device is connected to the network, you should be able to see it in the “Members” tab.

 

  1. Repeat steps 5-8 for all devices that you want to add to the network.

 

  1. Once all the devices are connected to the network, you should be able to communicate between them as if they were on the same local network.

 

  1. Please note that these steps are a general guideline, the exact steps may vary slightly depending on the device and operating system you’re using.

Installing Zerotier on Linux (Using Terminal)

Run the following commands in a Terminal window.

sudo apt install gnupg apt-transport-https

curl -s https://install.zerotier.com | sudo bash

To join a network use the following command:

sudo zerotier-cli join Your Network ID

Your linux machine will be assigned an IP from the subnet you set during the Zerotier network setup process. You can now access all your services using respective IP and ports.

Conclusion

So why deal with the frustration of CG-NAT when you can use Zerotier to bypass it? Give it a try, and see the difference it can make in your online experience. With Zerotier, the world is your network!
description: Setting up Zerotier to gain access to a home network behind CG-NAT.
title: Zerotier - Bypass CG-NAT

content:
Internet Ads: Now And Then

It should come at no surprise to everyone that advertisements on the internet are getting pretty ridiculous these days. They are getting out of hand. You don’t just see ads while browsing the internet, through web pages but also in almost every single app that connects to the internet. YouTube, Instagram, Facebook, Reddit to name a few.

Now we get it, Advertisements are the main sources of income for these companies, but that truly doesn’t justify the amount of advertisements that are thrown at users these days. Not to mention the types of Ads targeted.

It didn’t use to be like this of course. Remember the good ol’ internet days from 2012 to 15-16 ? Where the ads didn’t use to be so daunting ? And the content on platforms like YouTube used to actually be good? (But I don’t want to get into that now).

I have one main goal here : That is, by the end of this blog post, I want you to encounter the least amount of ads (and more than just ads) on the internet, to not only save time but also your peace of mind.

DNS Servers

Pihole DNS

Let’s get the more complicated stuff out of the way first. If you’ve never heard of Pihole before, it is basically a self-hosted DNS server that can block ads and websites. Its fully customizable and is really fast as it’s hosted locally in your network.

Setting up Pihole isn’t straightforward if you are new to servers and linux, but if you are interested or are already experienced with Linux servers then check out my Pihole Post in my Blogs Section.

DNS Servers

To maximize ad blocking, it is best to do it at the DNS level. This is of course done by setting up DNS servers.

  • There are a few ways to implement this:

If you have a Router, you could log in to it, find the DNS settings (It differs form router to router; look up yours if you are unsure) and change the DNS servers.

If you don’t have a router and are just using devices through Mobile Data, or maybe you don’t have access to your router, then you can make changes to the DNS individually.

If you have an Android Device running Android 9 +, you could use the Private DNS setting which can be found under **Network Settings.

You could make changes to your Network Adapter’s DNS Settings on your PC or MAC.

Keep in mind the Private DNS feature uses DNS addresses a bit differently than what you might be accustomed to seeing.

Recommended DNS Servers

Adguard DNS:

  • 94.140.14.14 and 94.140.15.15

Adguard has a plethora of servers meant for different purposes. Hence, I recommend checking out this website to see what best suits your needs.

Private DNS:

  • dns.adguard.com

Cisco’s OpenDNS is also a good option if you want content filtering.

There are also Ad blocking apps that you can install on your phone. If your phone is rooted, you can take things to another level, but that is out of the scope of this post.

Brave Browser

Brave Browser is hands down the best browser to use if you want ad blocking throughout the internet.

It not only blocks advertisements, pop-up ads, malicious web pages, but also blocks ads on websites like YouTube.

Now admittedly, it does have a few things that are unnecessary for most people like the crypto wallet etc. However, you can disable those in the settings. Oh, and while you’re messing around in the settings, make sure to change the default search engine to something you like (Google). With a little bit of tweaking Brave Browser can be everything you need.

As browsers like Google Chrome on android don’t support ad blocking or extensions, Brave for Android or IOS is a really good option.

Extensions

Let’s say you don’t wanna use the Brave Browser for whatever reason and want to use something like Chrome or Firefox. Then extensions are your best bet. Here’s to name a few:

  • uBlock Origin
  • AdBlock
  • AdBlock Plus

There are many more out there and again it’s hard to list every single one so head out there and find one that best suits your needs.

Modified Apps

By using the methods mentioned above you can only block ads on websites and maby inside a few apps if you used adguard or pihole but it’s very rare.

Hence, blocking ads on apps individually by installing a modified version of them is the more reliable option.

  • Now I know we’re walking on real thin ice here. People aren’t really comfortable installing Unknown Apps, however if you install them from trusted projects run by really good and well known communities then it’s not an issue.

Instander

A modified version of Instagram with more than just ad blocking. It also has features for Anonymity and options to view pictures in higher quality which is absolutely amazing for photographers.

IMO Instagram has been ruined by reels. It’s not what it used to be, but then again what is ? Although you can’t really remove reels from it, Instander does give you an option to stop autoplaying videos which will atleast help retain your peace of mind.

  • The project was started by thedise and you can download it from here

YouTube Vanced and YouTube Revanced

The ads on youtube need no introduction. Unbelievably ridiculous, unrelated, unskippable and unfathomable. I can go on, you get the point. YouTube Vanced was created to not only remove ads but also to implement user requested features which YouTube doesn’t care about.

  • Features like the
    • Old Video Quality Layout
    • Brightness and Volume Slider
    • The Return YouTube Dislike API
    • Sponsor Block API

Unfortunately the Vanced project was discontinued due to a DMCA by google. However, a similar project called Revanced was started to continue the legacy of Vanced.

Keep in mind the Revanced Project at the time of writing this post is still relatively new and thus will contain bugs. You can get the manager from here

  • Revanced has patches also for YouTube Music and Reddit.

Although the Vanced Project has been discontinued you can still find the manager on the net and install it in case Vanced works better than Revanced. Test and try it out for yourself.

Pro Tip: It is better to install the patched apks using the Non-Root method alongside Micro-G even if you have a rooted device.

Xmanager for Spotify

  • A trusted source for patched Spotify apks.
  • It has features of the premium version of Spotify and features like an all black theme for AMOLED devices.

Conclusion

All the things mentioned in this post is what I use in my day-to-day life.

Although there are a lot more projects out there that do various tasks, these fulfill the ad blocking needs for most people. The internet is worth exploring for projects like these. There are plenty out there that might just have the fix for you !
description: How to Block Most Advertisements while surfing the Internet. Using DNS, Vanced, Revanced, Modified APKs and more !
title: Live an Ad-Free Internet Life

content:
What is Pi-hole ? And It’s Uses

In simple terms, Pi hole is an application that can be installed on linux that acts as a custom DNS server. It can be used to block advertisements and unwanted websites while browsing through the internet. Pi-hole can do a lot more than just this. If needed it can also act as a DHCP server for your network and much more.

How Does It Work ?

Pi-hole basically acts like a filter between your router and the vast internet. Before your router brings back your quries (such as search results) from the internet, It first goes through Pi-Hole to remove unwanted results such as advertisements or malicious websites, spammy links and so on.

It can also be used to cache visited sites. So the next time you visit the site it loads faster.

Pi-hole Installation

Before installing make sure your server has a Static IP or is not a part of the DHCP list of IPs.

The installation is pretty simple and straight forward. You can also visit Pi-hole’s official github page for referernce.

  • To install you just need to run the following command
sudo curl -sSL https://install.pi-hole.net | bash

Follow the on-screen instructions and select the options using arrow keys and enter according to your needs.

Custom Installation

  • Select any DNS provider you want. It can be changed later.

 

  • Leave the default adlist. You can add more adlists later.

 

  • Let Pi-hole block ads over both IPv4 and Ipv6.

 

  • Install the Web Server as it is the most convenient way to access Pi-Hole

 

  • You can log queries if you want and for convenience you can select show all if its only you who will be monitoring the network.

Change The Password

After intall, Pi-hole will give you a pre-defined password. However it isn’t really easy to remember.

You can change the password by typing the command on the terminal.

sudo pihole -a -p

Change The Default Port

  • By default, Pi-Hole’s web interface runs on port 80. This is fine for most people but port 80 is widely used and it may even be in use if you have many services. So its best to change it to some other port.

 

  • You can change the port by typing the following command
sudo nano /etc/lighttpd/external.conf

 

  • Add the following to the conf file : server.port := 8085, save and exit out of the file.(You can change the port number accordingly)

 

  • Finally, type sudo systemctl restart lighttpd for your changes to take place.

Change DNS Servers On Your Router

Once Pi-Hole is up and running you can point the Primary DNS server IP (in your router) to your server so that all the traffic goes through Pi-Hole.

It is advisable to leave the Secondary DNS server IP to something like 1.1.1.1 or 8.8.8.8 (your choice) incase your server shuts down.

Adding Adlists

By default, Pi-hole comes with an adlists with a bunch of URLs. However, you can add more by heading over to Group Management, Adlists.

Keep in mind not to add too many adlists as it can slow down the performance. Some adlists may contain URLs of sites that already exist in your installed adlists. So find a good balance between privacy and usability.

Adlist Sources

  • The Firebog. It has a ton of adlists in various categories like advertisements, malware etc.
  • NSFW Adlists:
    • https://raw.githubusercontent.com/StevenBlack/hosts/master/alternates/porn/hosts
    • https://raw.- githubusercontent.com/cbuijs/shallalist/master/porn/domains
  • Adaway Default BLocklist : https://adaway.org/hosts.txt
  • Block List Project. It has a lot of adlists in various categories.

White List And Black List

It is Important that you monitor your network through the query log for a couple days and make sure everything works properly (chances are, it won’t).

If you find a link that is causing issues by being blocked, then allow it by whitelistsing it.

Similarly, if you come accross links that are shady and are not being blocked by Pi-Hole then blacklist them.

A general rule of thumb if you run services like Pi-hole is to always check your query log if something doesn’t load properly or isn’t behaving the way it should generally. Chances are that it maybe due to Pi-hole (adlists).

Pi-hole Analysis

The above image shows the statistics of my Pi-hole instance that’s been running for nearly a year. (changes made now and then).

Trying to find the balance between the total queries blocked and total queries is essential to know if your Pi-hole is performing efficiently. The average Percentage Blocked on a daily basis for my network is around 65 % which is a healthy number. If the percentage is too less then you’ve got too many adlists that aren’t working as intended.

  • It is important to keep monitoring your network from time to time to see if things are performing as they should or if they need tweaking. You may need to update adlists once in a while.

Pi-hole Alone Is Not The Answer !

If you think that you can block all the ads on all platforms, block all the malicious websites, all the spam links then you my friend are wrong !

Pi-hole is great for blocking everything mentioned so far but only to a point. It isn’t perfect and It’s hard for us to keep track of all the new advertisemnt, malware, spam links that are created every single day.

It goes a long way if you use pihole along with apllications that go hand in hand like Brave Browser for instance. Provided brave does a pretty good job even without Pi-hole when it comes to blocking ads but that was just one example.

We can take thing up a notch by using OpenDNS and configuring it to our needs !

Setting Up Open DNS

  • Go to the Settings tab on your Pi-hole dashboard, then the DNS tab and select OpenDNS as your Upstream Servers.

 

  • In order to get Open DNS properly configured, you need an account. To get the account head over to OpenDNS’ Consumer Page and select the OpenDNS Home option and sign up.

 

  • Now here’s a little tricky part. You need to know if you have a Static IP or a Dynamic IP. If you have a Static IP then you can skip over to Configuration part. But if you have a Dynamic IP (like me) then you need to perform a few more steps.

OpenDNS Dynamic IP

As your IP changes from time to time, you need a way to keep the OpenDNS server updated with your IP. You can do this by using an IP updater called ddclient which you can run on your server.

  • Install the client :
sudo apt install ddclient
  • Configure the client:
sudo nano /etc/ddclient.conf
  • Edit the info accordingly:
ssl = yes
use = web, web = whatismyip.org
server = updates.opendns.com
protocol = dyndns2
login = username in OpenDNS                  
password = 'key OpenDNS'                     
(Name of the network you set up in OpenDNS)
  • Run the command to see if everything works:
sudo ddclient -verbose -file /etc/ddclient.conf
  • Run these commands to make ddclient automatically start after your server reboots:
sudo systemctl start ddclient

sudo systemctl enable ddclient
  • That should be it for getting the ddclient up and running.

Configure OpenDNS

The main configuration that you need to do is at the setting of your dashboard. Once you select your network you can customise your Web Content Flitering.

In the Security tab, I recommend having Malware/Bot Protection, Phishing Protection turned on.

You can edit the ‘block page’ to your liking in the Customization tab.

Conclusion

By combining both Pi-hole and OpenDNS and other adblocking measures you could create a very secure, reliable network that’ll keep you and anyone in your network safe from the dark sides of the internet (to a certain degree ofcourse !).
description: Setting up Pi-hole and using Open DNS for a secure home network
title: Pi-hole + OpenDNS

content:
What Does Unlocking Mean ?

Here, unlocking means to get access to features that were locked (restricted) by the provider.In this case the provider is the ISP and not the manufacturer (Huawei).

Why Is Unlocking Necessary ?

The Huawei B310s-927 is a very famous router provided by ISPs for mobile networks. Meaning, you could use a SIM card to get data and have access to features found in traditional routers. However the ISP modifies the router to only accept their SIM cards and not others’. This isn’t a big deal if you’re in their area of coverage.

If you were to move out of their area of coverage then the router is deemed unusable (in relative terms). Unlocking the router however allows you to put any SIM card form anywhere around the world and use it without any restrictions.

Some Backstory

Unlocking this router was one of my first proper IT projects.I first started working on this project about 4 years ago. The procedures I had used for unlocking the router back then were a bit complicated. I had to solder a Data/USB cable to the motherboard of the router to connect it to my computer which allowed me to transfer necessary files for downgrading the firmware. At that time I had little to no idea what I was doing as I was pretty new to it and was mostly scouring the internet for tutorials and articles.

Nowadays the entire process is pretty starightforward and can be done within 20 minutes by using protocols like telnet to connect to the router.

I won’t get into the details on how to unlock the router as there are countless tutorials on youtube and articles on the internet that already cover it.

AIO Tools

This is something that I came across recently. A few developers created an AIO (All In One) Tool that cointains features like OpenVPN (OVPN) sTunnel, SoftEther and ShadowSocksR. The tool can be installed within a few minutes using a script and installs a seperate web page that can be accessed through a specified port.

This is an absolute game changer as by default the router doesn’t come with any VPN functionalities let alone OVPN and other Tunneling features.

Installation Procedures

During my research I wasn’t able to find tutorials that worked right out of the box as most if not all tutorials weren’t in english. However after a lot of trial and error and seeing what works best this is what worked for me:

Installing A Modified Firmware

Assuming that you already have your PC and Router connected via Ethernet and can access the router, the first step is to install a modified firmware (.bin file) which you can get from here and install it through a Local Update. I recommend you only install the .bin file from here and nothing else.

All the credit for files go to their respective owners/ developers.

Installing The AIO Tool

Installing the modified firmware is necessary as in my experience the AIO install doesn’t work without it. Once you have installed the modified firmware you can proceed to install the AIO tool for which the link can be found here.

Make sure you’re connected to the router (do not change the default IP Address) and run the script.

If everything works correctly it should say connected and proceed with the install.

Accessing The AIO Tool

The web interface can be accessed by visiting 192.168.8.1:8989 ; the default port is 8989.It is also necessary to have internet access in order to open the AIO Tool webpage but that’s not the case for the router’s web page (which is obvious). You can add your config files, upload them and connect to your desired protocol.

Keep in mind that you can only upload 1 config at a time. Incase you need to upload a different config, you have to remove the previous config from the Configuration Remover.

Conclusion

By installing the modified firmware one could gain access to hidden settings that allows the user to select LTE / Network Bands which is handy to have in different corners of the world. AIO tools allows you to connect to your desired VPN Provider and much more.

By having these options unlocked / installed it makes the B310s-927 a perfect router to take with you on journies away from home. It not only gets you better reception (Antennae play a huge role) but also keeps you safe online by having a VPN connection if you want to connect to public networks !

The only thing this router lacks which could make a huge difference in its usability is a wirless repeater mode. If it did, it could mean that the router could connect to other networks (Wi-Fi) without the need of an Ethernet cable. Connecting to public networks with an ethernet cable isn’t really a viable option.
description: Unlocking a Huawei B310s-927 Router and Installing OVPN
title: Unlocking Huawei B310s-927 + OVPN
